form.longName: PhenX PX091401 - Respiratory Rate Infant Protocol
form.preferredDefinition: For infants (15 days to 3 years of age), a study staff member listens to breath sounds via a stethoscope lightly placed on the infant's chest for 60 seconds to count the number of complete respiratory cycles (one inspiration and one expiration). Note that because respiratory rate in infants is significantly different when awake vs. when asleep, studies should be consistent in measuring this variable.

headerInstruction.text: Infants (15 days to 3 years) should be calm, either awake (including quietly seated or quietly playing) or asleep (sleep not associated with any spontaneous movement, including no eye movements or vocalizations). Infants: count breath sounds i..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Date of Measurement (date_of_measurement)
Infant awake (infant_awake)
Number of respiratory cycles in one minute (respiratory_cycles)

protocol.preferredDefinition: For infants (15 days to 3 years of age), a study staff member listens to breath sounds via a stethoscope lightly placed on the infant's chest for 60 seconds to count the number of complete respiratory cycles (one inspiration and one expiration). Note that because respiratory rate in infants is significantly different when awake vs. when asleep, studies should be consistent in measuring this variable.

form.longName: PhenX PX091402 - Respiratory Rate Child Protocol
form.preferredDefinition: For children (4 to 16 years of age), a study staff member counts the number of complete respiratory cycles (one inspiration and one expiration) a subject breathes in 60 seconds.

headerInstruction.text: 1) Use a watch which can measure time in seconds.2) Child (416 years of age) should be seated, may be awake or asleep but should be calm, not agitated observe a complete respiratory cycle and count partial respiratory cycles as complete.4) Cou..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Number of respiratory cycles in one minute (pxt91402_respiratory_cycles)
Respiratory depth comments (respiratory_depth_comments)
Breathing pattern comments (breathing_pattern_comments)
Breathing depth comments (breathing_depth_comments)

protocol.preferredDefinition: For children (4 to 16 years of age), a study staff member counts the number of complete respiratory cycles (one inspiration and one expiration) a subject breathes in 60 seconds.

form.longName: PhenX PX091403 - Respiratory Rate Adult Protocol
form.preferredDefinition: A study staff member counts the number of complete respiratory cycles (one inspiration and one expiration) a subject breathes in 60 seconds.

question.questionText: 1) Use a watch that can measure time in seconds.2) Place the subject's arm in a relaxed position across his abdomen or lower chest.3) Observe a complete respiratory cycle (one inspiration and one expiration).4) Count the number of respiration for 60 seconds. For adults with regular respiratory rhythm, it may be adequate to count for 30 seconds and multiply by two.5) While counting, note whether depth is shallow, normal, or deep, and whether rhythm is normal or an altered pattern.6) Record the results. (pxt91403_respiratory_cycles)
Respiratory depth comments (shallow, normal, deep) (pxt91403_respiratory_depth_comments)
Breathing pattern comments (rhythm: normal or altered) (pxt91403_breathing_pattern_comments)
Breathing depth comments (shallow, normal, deep) (pxt91403_breathing_depth_comments)

protocol.preferredDefinition: A study staff member counts the number of complete respiratory cycles (one inspiration and one expiration) a subject breathes in 60 seconds.

form.longName: PhenX PX091501 - Sleep Apnea Adult Protocol
form.preferredDefinition: The questionnaire asks about risk factors for sleep apnea, namely snoring behavior, wake time, sleepiness or fatigue, and the presence of high blood pressure. The protocol begins with information that an individual self-reports on height, weight, age, and sex. The 10 questions address snoring, fatigue, and high blood pressure. An algorithm is provided to classify study participants into high or low risk based on response.

question.questionText: Height (m): (sleep_apnea_height)
Weight (kg): (sleep_apnea_weight)
Age: (sleep_apnea_age)
Gender: (sleep_apnea_gender)
CATEGORY 1 Do you snore? (sleep_apnea_snore)
CATEGORY 1 Your snoring is: (sleep_apnea_snore_loudness)

validValue.meaningText: Very loud can be heard in adjacent rooms
validValue.description: Very loud can be heard in adjacent rooms

question.questionText: CATEGORY 1 How often do you snore? (sleep_apnea_snore_frequency)
CATEGORY 1 Has your snoring ever bothered other people? (sleep_apnea_snore_bother_other)
CATEGORY 1 Has anyone noticed that you quit breathing during your sleep? (sleep_apnea_quit_breathing_sleep)
CATEGORY 2 How often do you feel tired or fatigued after your sleep? (sleep_apnea_tired_fatigued_after)
CATEGORY 2 During your waking time, do you feel tired, fatigued, or not up to par? (sleep_apnea_tired_fatigued_waking)
CATEGORY 2 Have you ever nodded off or fallen asleep while driving a vehicle? (sleep_apnea_nodded_asleep_driving)
CATEGORY 2 How often does this occur? (sleep_apnea_asleep_driving_frequency)
CATEGORY 3 Do you have high blood pressure? (sleep_apnea_high_blood_pressure)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The questionnaire asks about risk factors for sleep apnea, namely snoring behavior, wake time, sleepiness or fatigue, and the presence of high blood pressure. The protocol begins with information that an individual self-reports on height, weight, age, and sex. The 10 questions address snoring, fatigue, and high blood pressure. An algorithm is provided to classify study participants into high or low risk based on response.

form.longName: PhenX PX091502 - Sleep Apnea Child Protocol
form.preferredDefinition: The Pediatric Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) protocol is a parent questionnaire for children from 2 through 18 years, and rated on a simple three-point scale ("yes," "no," or "don't know") for all items except the inattention/hyperactivity items that are rated on a four-point Likert scale. This protocol provides an overall total score and five sleep scales: (1) Sleep-Related Breathing Disorders (SRBD), (2) Snoring, (3) Sleepiness, (4) Behavior, and (5) Periodic Limb Movement Disorder (PLMD).

question.questionText: Today's date: (interview_date)
Where are you completing this questionnaire? (interview_location)
Date of child's birth: (child_birth_date)
Sex: (child_gender)
Current height (feet): (child_height_feet)
Current height (inches): (child_height_inches)
Current weight (pounds): (child_weight_pound)
Grade in school (if applicable): (child_grade_in_school)

Nighttime and sleep behavior: WHILE SLEEPING, DOES YOUR CHILD ever snore? (child_snore_ever)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: WHILE SLEEPING, DOES YOUR CHILD snore more than half the time? (child_snore_more_half_time)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: WHILE SLEEPING, DOES YOUR CHILD always snore? (child_always_snore)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: WHILE SLEEPING, DOES YOUR CHILD snore loudly? (child_snore_loudly)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: WHILE SLEEPING, DOES YOUR CHILD have "heavy" or loud breathing"? (child_heavy_loud_breathing)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: WHILE SLEEPING, DOES YOUR CHILD have trouble breathing, or struggle to breathe? (child_trouble_struggle_breathing)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: HAVE YOU EVER seen your child stop breathing during the night? (child_stop_breathing_night_ever)
If so, please describe what has happened: (child_stop_breathing_night_ever_describe)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: HAVE YOU EVER been concerned about your child's breathing during sleep? (child_stop_breathing_night_description)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: HAVE YOU EVER had to shake your sleeping child to get him or her to breathe, or wake up and breathe? (shake_wake_sleeping_child_breathe)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: HAVE YOU EVER seen your child wake up with a snorting sound? (child_wake_snoring_sound_ever)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: DOES YOUR CHILD have restless sleep? (child_restless_sleep)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: DOES YOUR CHILD describe restlessness of the legs when in bed? (child_restless_legs_in_bed)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: DOES YOUR CHILD have "growing pains" (unexplained leg pains)? (child_growing_unexplained_leg_pains)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: DOES YOUR CHILD have "growing pains" that are worst in bed? (child_growing_pains_worst_bed)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: WHILE YOUR CHILD SLEEPS, HAVE YOU SEEN brief kicks of one leg or both legs? (child_legs_brief_kicks)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: WHILE YOUR CHILD SLEEPS, HAVE YOU SEEN repeated kicks or jerks of the legs at regular intervals (i.e., about every 20 to 40 seconds)? (child_legs_repeated_kicks_regular)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: AT NIGHT, DOES YOUR CHILD USUALLY become sweaty, or do the pajamas usually become wet with perspiration? (child_night_sweaty_wet_perspiration)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: AT NIGHT, DOES YOUR CHILD USUALLY get out of bed (for any reason)? (child_night_get_out_bed)
Nighttime and sleep behavior: AT NIGHT, DOES YOUR CHILD USUALLY get out of bed to urinate? (child_night_urinate)
If YOUR CHILD USUALLY gets out of bed to urinate, how many times each night, on average? (child_night_urinate_times)
Does your child usually sleep with the mouth open? (child_sleep_mouth_open)
Is your child's nose usually congested or "stuffed" at night? (child_congested_stuffed_nose_night)
Do any allergies affect your child's ability to breathe through the nose? (child_allergies_affect_breathe_nose)
DOES YOUR CHILD tend to breathe through the mouth during the day? (child_breathe_through_mouth_day)
DOES YOUR CHILD have a dry mouth on waking up in the morning? (child_dry_mouth_waking_morning)
DOES YOUR CHILD complain of an upset stomach at night? (child_upset_stomach_night)
DOES YOUR CHILD get a burning feeling in the throat at night? (child_burning_throat_night)
DOES YOUR CHILD grind his or her teeth at night? (child_grind_teeth_night)
DOES YOUR CHILD occasionally wet the bed? (child_wet_bed)
Has your child ever walked during sleep ("sleep walking")? (child_sleep_walking)
Have you ever heard your child talk during sleep ("sleep talking")? (child_sleep_talking)
Does your child have nightmares once a week or more on average? (child_nightmare)
Has your child ever woken up screaming during the night? (child_wake_up_screaming_night)
Has your child ever been moving or behaving, at night, in a way that made you think your child was neither completely awake nor asleep? (child_neither_awake_asleep_ever)
If so, please describe what has happened: (child_neither_awake_asleep_ever_desc)
Does your child have difficulty falling asleep at night? (child_difficulty_falling_asleep_night)
How long does it take your child to fall asleep at night? (a guess is O.K.) (child_time_falling_asleep_night)
At bedtime does your child usually have difficult "routines" or "rituals" argue a lot, or otherwise behave badly? (child_bedtime_difficult_routines_rituals)
DOES YOUR CHILD bang his or her head or rock his or her body when going to sleep? (child_bang_head_rock_body)
DOES YOUR CHILD wake up more than twice a night on average? (child_wake_multiple_times_night)
DOES YOUR CHILD have trouble falling back asleep if he or she wakes up at night? (child_trouble_back_asleep_night)
DOES YOUR CHILD wake up early in the morning and have difficulty going back to sleep? (child_trouble_back_asleep_morning)
Does the time at which your child goes to bed change a lot from day to day? (child_bedtime_change_a_lot)
Does the time at which your child gets up from bed change a lot from day to day? (child_get_up_change_a_lot)
WHAT TIME DOES YOUR CHILD USUALLY go to bed during the week? (time_child_bed_weekday)
WHAT TIME DOES YOUR CHILD USUALLY go to bed on the weekend or vacation? (time_child_bed_weekend_vacation)

DOES YOUR CHILD complain that he or she feels sleepy during the day? (child_feel_sleepy_day)

At what age did this first develop? (child_overweight_first_age)
Has a doctor ever told you that your child has a higharched palate (roof of the mouth)? (child_high_arched_palate_roof_mouth)
Has your child ever taken Ritalin (methylphenidate) for behavioral problems? (child_take_ritalin_ever)
Has a health professional ever said that your child has attentiondeficit disorder (ADD) or attentiondeficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)? (child_add_adhd_ever)
If you are currently at a clinic with your child to see a physician, what is the problem that brought you? (child_medical_problem)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Pediatric Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) protocol is a parent questionnaire for children from 2 through 18 years, and rated on a simple three-point scale ("yes," "no," or "don't know") for all items except the inattention/hyperactivity items that are rated on a four-point Likert scale. This protocol provides an overall total score and five sleep scales: (1) Sleep-Related Breathing Disorders (SRBD), (2) Snoring, (3) Sleepiness, (4) Behavior, and (5) Periodic Limb Movement Disorder (PLMD).

form.preferredDefinition: A spirometric test requires that the subject take a full, deep breath and then exhale as forcefully as possible into a hand-held portable spirometer. The subject's effort is called the forced expiratory maneuver and most commonly measures the amount and speed of air that is exhaled. The total amount (volume) of air exhaled is called the forced vital capacity (FVC). The amount (volume) of air exhaled in 1 second is called the forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1). While hand-held spirometers are commonly used in clinical research studies, the same results can be obtained from more sophisticated floor-mounted devices that are typically available in a respiratory function testing laboratory.

headerInstruction.text: Full protocol is available in the Spirometry Standards PDF, available at:"https://www.phenxtoolkit.org/toolkit_content/supplemental_info/respiratory/additional_info/ATS_ERS_Spirometry_Standards_2005.pdf"> ATS ERS Spirometry Standards (2005)

protocol.preferredDefinition: A spirometric test requires that the subject take a full, deep breath and then exhale as forcefully as possible into a hand-held portable spirometer. The subject's effort is called the forced expiratory maneuver and most commonly measures the amount and speed of air that is exhaled. The total amount (volume) of air exhaled is called the forced vital capacity (FVC). The amount (volume) of air exhaled in 1 second is called the forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1). While hand-held spirometers are commonly used in clinical research studies, the same results can be obtained from more sophisticated floor-mounted devices that are typically available in a respiratory function testing laboratory.

form.longName: PhenX PX091701 - Urine Assay For Tobacco Smoke Exposure
form.preferredDefinition:
A biospecimen is collected from the respondent to measure cotinine, a marker of either smoking or of environmental tobacco smoke exposure. One of the most common methods is via a urine sample obtained from the respondent.
Cotinine in urine is measured by gas chromatography mass spectrometry (GC-MS).

headerInstruction.text: The respondent is asked to urinate in a sterile 90mL urine specimen container. Children above the age of 10 and adults can selfcollect the urine. The specimen should be refrigerated immediately after collection. Aliquot 3mLs into a 4 mL cryovi..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Urine Assay For Tobacco Smoke Exposure
module.preferredDefinition: Urine Assay For Tobacco Smoke Exposure

question.questionText: Concentration of urinary cotinine in ng/mL. (cotinine_concentration)

protocol.longName: Urine Assay for Tobacco Smoke Exposure
protocol.preferredDefinition:
A biospecimen is collected from the respondent to measure cotinine, a marker of either smoking or of environmental tobacco smoke exposure. One of the most common methods is via a urine sample obtained from the respondent.
Cotinine in urine is measured by gas chromatography mass spectrometry (GC-MS).

form.longName: PhenX PX100101 - Assessment Of Pubertal Development Female
form.preferredDefinition: The female participant uses the Tanner staging drawings to self-assess her breast development and pubertal hair.

question.questionText: Select the option that is closest to your current breast stage. (female_breast_development_stage)

validValue.meaningText: The nipple is raised a little in this stage. The rest of the breast is still flat.
validValue.description: The nipple is raised a little in this stage. The rest of the breast is still flat.

validValue.meaningText: This is the breast bud stage. In this stage the nipple is raised more than in stage 1. The breast is a small mound. The dark area around the nipple (areola) is larger than in stage 1.
validValue.description: This is the breast bud stage. In this stage the nipple is raised more than in stage 1. The breast is a small mound. The dark area around the nipple (areola) is larger than in stage 1.

validValue.meaningText: The areola and the breast are both larger than in stage 2. The areola does not stick out away from the breast.
validValue.description: The areola and the breast are both larger than in stage 2. The areola does not stick out away from the breast.

validValue.meaningText: The areola and the nipple make up a mound that sticks up above the shape of the breast. (Note: This stage may not happen at all for some teenagers. Some teenagers develop from stage 3 to stage 5 with no stage 4.).
validValue.description: The areola and the nipple make up a mound that sticks up above the shape of the breast. (Note: This stage may not happen at all for some teenagers. Some teenagers develop from stage 3 to stage 5 with no stage 4.).

validValue.meaningText: This is the mature adult stage. The breasts are fully developed. Only the nipple sticks out in this stage. The areola has moved back in the general shape of the breast.
validValue.description: This is the mature adult stage. The breasts are fully developed. Only the nipple sticks out in this stage. The areola has moved back in the general shape of the breast.

question.questionText: breast stage 1 image (breast_stage1)
breast stage 2 image (breast_stage2)
breast stage 3 image (breast_stage3)
breast stage 4 image (breast_stage4)
breast stage 5 image (breast_stage5)
Select the option that is closest to your current pubic hair stage. (female_pubic_hair_development_stage)

validValue.meaningText: There is a little long, lightly coloured hair. This hair may be straight or a little curly.
validValue.description: There is a little long, lightly coloured hair. This hair may be straight or a little curly.

validValue.meaningText: The hair is darker in this stage. It is coarser and more curled. It has spread out and thinly covers a bigger area.
validValue.description: The hair is darker in this stage. It is coarser and more curled. It has spread out and thinly covers a bigger area.

validValue.meaningText: The hair is now as dark, curly, and coarse as that of an adult woman. However, the area that the hair covers is not as large as that of an adult woman. The hair has not spread out to the legs.
validValue.description: The hair is now as dark, curly, and coarse as that of an adult woman. However, the area that the hair covers is not as large as that of an adult woman. The hair has not spread out to the legs.

validValue.meaningText: The hair is like that of an adult woman. It also covers the same area as that of an adult woman. The hair usually forms a triangular pattern as it spreads out to the legs.
validValue.description: The hair is like that of an adult woman. It also covers the same area as that of an adult woman. The hair usually forms a triangular pattern as it spreads out to the legs.

question.questionText: pubic_fem_stage1 image (pubic_fem_stage1)
pubic_fem_stage2 image (pubic_fem_stage2)
pubic_fem_stage3 image (pubic_fem_stage3)
pubic_fem_stage4 image (pubic_fem_stage4)
pubic_fem_stage5 image (pubic_fem_stage5)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The female participant uses the Tanner staging drawings to self-assess her breast development and pubertal hair.

form.longName: PhenX PX100102 - Assessment Of Pubertal Development Male
form.preferredDefinition: The male participant uses the Tanner staging drawings to self-assess the stage of puberty he has reached in terms of the size and shape of his testes and his pubic hair.

question.questionText: Select the option that is closest to your current stage of physical development. (penis_scrotum_testis_development_stage)

validValue.meaningText: The size and shape of the testes, scrotum (the sac holding the testes) and penis are about the same as when you were younger.
validValue.description: The size and shape of the testes, scrotum (the sac holding the testes) and penis are about the same as when you were younger.

validValue.meaningText: The penis is a little bit bigger. The scrotum has dropped and the skin of the scrotum has changed. The testes are bigger.
validValue.description: The penis is a little bit bigger. The scrotum has dropped and the skin of the scrotum has changed. The testes are bigger.

validValue.meaningText: The penis has grown longer, the testes have grown and dropped lower.
validValue.description: The penis has grown longer, the testes have grown and dropped lower.

validValue.meaningText: The penis is longer and wider. The head of the penis is bigger, the scrotum is a darker colour and bigger. The testes are bigger.
validValue.description: The penis is longer and wider. The head of the penis is bigger, the scrotum is a darker colour and bigger. The testes are bigger.

validValue.meaningText: The penis, scrotum and testes are the size and shape of a man's.
validValue.description: The penis, scrotum and testes are the size and shape of a man's.

question.questionText: penis_stage1 image (penis_stage1)
penis_stage2 image (penis_stage2)
penis_stage3 image (penis_stage3)
penis_stage4 image (penis_stage4)
penis_stage5 image (penis_stage5)
Select the option that is closest to your current stage of physical development. (male_pubic_hair_development_stage)

validValue.meaningText: There is no hair at all.
validValue.description: There is no hair at all.

validValue.meaningText: There is a little soft, long, lightly coloured hair at the base of the penis. It may be straight or a little curly.
validValue.description: There is a little soft, long, lightly coloured hair at the base of the penis. It may be straight or a little curly.

validValue.meaningText: The hair is darker and more curled. It has spread out and thinly covers a bigger area.
validValue.description: The hair is darker and more curled. It has spread out and thinly covers a bigger area.

validValue.meaningText: The hair is as dark and curly as that of a man, but it hasn't spread out to the legs.
validValue.description: The hair is as dark and curly as that of a man, but it hasn't spread out to the legs.

validValue.meaningText: The hair is like that of a man. It has spread out to the legs.
validValue.description: The hair is like that of a man. It has spread out to the legs.

question.questionText: pubic_male_stage1 image (pubic_mal_stage1)
pubic_male_stage2 image (pubic_mal_stage2)
pubic_male_stage3 image (pubic_mal_stage3)
pubic_male_stage4 image (pubic_mal_stage4)
pubic_male_stage5 image (pubic_mal_stage5)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The male participant uses the Tanner staging drawings to self-assess the stage of puberty he has reached in terms of the size and shape of his testes and his pubic hair.

form.longName: PhenX PX100201 - Causes And Treatments Of Known Infertility Male
form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the participant questions about whether the participant or partner has needed medical assistance with having a baby, the type of assistance, and the type of infertility problems.

module.longName: Causes And Treatments Of Known Infertility Male
module.preferredDefinition: Causes And Treatments Of Known Infertility Male

question.questionText: Did you or your partner* ever go / Have you or your partner ever been to a doctor or other medical care provider to talk about ways to help you have a baby together? (help_have_baby_see_doctor)
Which of the services (did / have) you or your / partner* (have / had) to help you have a baby together? (help_have_baby_service_varicocele_treatment_enum)
Which other services (did / have) you or your / partner* (have / had) to help you have a baby together? (help_have_baby_service_other_medical)
When you and your partner* went for medical help to have a baby together, were you ever told that you had any of the following male infertility problems? (help_have_baby_male_infertility_none_enum)
*Note: The questions have been modified by the PhenX Working Group to indicate partner instead of wife. (note_0100201)

protocol.longName: Causes and Treatments of Known Infertility - Male
protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the participant questions about whether the participant or partner has needed medical assistance with having a baby, the type of assistance, and the type of infertility problems.

form.longName: PhenX PX100202 - Causes And Treatments Of Known Infertility Female
form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the participant questions about whether the participant or partner has needed medical assistance with having a baby, the type of assistance, and the type of infertility problems.

module.longName: Causes And Treatments Of Known Infertility Female
module.preferredDefinition: Causes And Treatments Of Known Infertility Female

question.questionText: Did you or your partner* ever go / Have you or your partner* ever been to a doctor or other medical care provider to talk about ways to help you have a baby together? (pxt100202_help_have_baby_see_doctor)
Which of the services (did / have) you or your / partner* (have / had) to help you have a baby together? (help_have_baby_service_varicocele_treatment_enum_enum)
Which other services (did / have) you or your / partner* (have / had) to help you have a baby together? (pxt100202_help_have_baby_service_other_medical)

When you and your partner* went for medical help to have a baby together, were you ever told that you had any of the following male infertility problems? (help_have_baby_male_infertility_none_enum_enum)
*Note: The questions have been modified by the PhenX Working Group to indicate partner instead of husband. (note_0100202)
Has a doctor or other medical care provider ever told you you had fibroid tumors or myomas in your uterus? (had_uterus_fibroid_tumor)
Has a doctor or other medical care provider ever told you you had endometriosis? (had_endometriosis)

protocol.longName: Causes and Treatments of Known Infertility - Female
protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the participant questions about whether the participant or partner has needed medical assistance with having a baby, the type of assistance, and the type of infertility problems.

form.preferredDefinition: Female participants are asked whether they have had a tubal ligation and whether they are able to have children. They are also asked about whether their male partners can have children. Female participants are then asked about the type of birth control they have used in the past and the type they are currently using.

question.questionText: Have you ever had both of your tubes tied, cut, or removed? This procedure is often called a tubal ligation or tubal sterilization. (ASKED IF RESPONDENT (R) IS NOT CURRENTLY PREGNANT) (tubal_ligation_sterilization)
Have you ever had any other operation that makes it impossible for you to have (a/another) baby? (other_sterilization_operation)

Many women who have only one (tube tied/ovary removed) can still have babies because they are not completely sterile. As far as you know, are you completely sterile from this operation, that is, does it make it impossible for you to have a baby in the future? (completely_sterile_woman_female)
Has (HUSBAND/PARTNER) ever had a vasectomy or any other operation that would make it impossible for him to father a baby in the future? (vasectomy_operation)
What type of operation did (HUSBAND/PARTNER) have? (vasectomy_operation_type)
As far as you know, is he completely sterile from this operation, that is, does it make it impossible for him to father a baby in the future? (completely_sterile_man_male)
Have you ever used birth control pills? (birth_control_pill)
Have you ever used oral contraceptives for two months or more for any reason (contraception, acne, menstrual irregularity, etc.)? (oral_contraceptive_ever)
How old were you when you began using oral contraceptives? (oral_contraceptive_first_age)
For how long in total have you used oral contraceptives? (oral_contraceptive_total_years)

validValue.meaningText: More than one year but less than ten years
validValue.description: More than one year but less than ten years

question.questionText: Have you ever used condoms or rubbers with a partner? (condom_rubber)
Have you ever had sex with a partner who had a vasectomy? (have_sex_vasectomy_partner_ever)
Have you ever had sex with a partner who used withdrawal or "pulling out"?" (have_sex_withdrawal_partner_ever)
(Have you ever used) DepoProvera® or injectables (or shots)? (depo_provera_injectable_shot)
(Have you ever used) Norplant® (implants)? (norplant_implant)
Have you ever used rhythm or safe period by calendar to prevent pregnancy? (rhythm_safe_period_calendar)
(Have you ever used) Natural family planning or safe period by temperature or cervical mucus test to prevent pregnancy? (safe_period_temperature_cervical_mucus)
(Have you ever used) Morning after" pills or Emergency Contraception?" (morning_after_pill_emergency_contraception)
How many different times have you used emergency contraception? (emergency_contraception_times)
(Have you ever used) a diaphragm with or without jelly or cream? (diaphragm)
(Have you ever used) Female condoms or vaginal pouches? (female_condom_vaginal_pouch)
(Have you ever used) Foam? (foam)
(Have you ever used) Jelly or cream (other than with a diaphragm)? (jelly_cream)
(Have you ever used) A Cervical cap? (cervical_cap)
(Have you ever used) A Suppository or an insert? (suppository_insert)
(Have you ever used) The Today® sponge? (today_sponge)
(Have you ever used) An IUD, coil, or loop? (iud_coil_loop)
(Have you ever used) Lunelle, a onceamonth injection? (lunelle_once_a_month_injection)
(Have you ever used) The contraceptive patch? (contraceptive_patch)
Have you used any other methods? (birth_control_other_method)
IF R USED AN OTHER" METHOD OF CONTRACEPTION Specify (birth_control_other_method_specify)
Are you currently using any method of birth control? (currently_use_birth_control_method)
Mark methods of birth control you are currently using. 16 = otherMark methods of birth control you are currently using (currently_birth_control_method_other_enum)
Mark methods of birth control you are currently using. Specify Other. (currently_birth_control_method_other_specify)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Female participants are asked whether they have had a tubal ligation and whether they are able to have children. They are also asked about whether their male partners can have children. Female participants are then asked about the type of birth control they have used in the past and the type they are currently using.

form.preferredDefinition: Male participants are also asked about contraception use in the last 12 months.

question.questionText: Including any methods you may have already told me about and methods you may have used only once, during the last 12 months, which of these methods did you and she use to prevent pregnancy or sexually transmitted diseases? 10 = Something else (prevent_pregnancy_std_method_something_else_enum)

validValue.meaningText: Tubal ligation (tubes tied) or female sterilization
validValue.description: Tubal ligation (tubes tied) or female sterilization

protocol.preferredDefinition: Male participants are also asked about contraception use in the last 12 months.

form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the participant questions about whether she/he and male/female partner are trying to become pregnant. If the participant answers that she/he and her/his partner are trying to become pregnant, the interviewer asks how long they have been trying.

question.questionText: Are you and (PARTNER'S NAME) currently trying to get pregnant? (try_pregnancy_currently)
How long (how many months) have you and (PARTNER'S NAME) been trying to get pregnant? (try_pregnancy_months)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the participant questions about whether she/he and male/female partner are trying to become pregnant. If the participant answers that she/he and her/his partner are trying to become pregnant, the interviewer asks how long they have been trying.

form.longName: PhenX PX100501 - Female Reproductive Organ Surgical Procedures
form.preferredDefinition: The participant answers a question about whether she has had a hysterectomy. If so, she answers a question about whether she has also had any ovaries removed and if so, at what age.

question.questionText: Have you had a hysterectomy (womb removed)? (hysterectomy_womb_removed)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The participant answers a question about whether she has had a hysterectomy. If so, she answers a question about whether she has also had any ovaries removed and if so, at what age.
